question: The term “Regional Anti-Terrorist Structure (RATS)”, sometimes seen in the news, is associated to which of the following organisations?
explanation: The Regional Anti-Terrorist Structure (RATS) is a permanent organ of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) which serves to promote cooperation of member states against the three evils of terrorism, separatism and extremism. Its headquarters are located in Tashkent, Uzbekistan. The Head of RATS is elected to a three-year term.
